reviewText: My little daughter has absolutely *loved* this game and has played through it several times.\nIt seems to be recommended for children 5-8, but I suspect kids near the upper end of that age range will quickly play through this.\nThe artwork is lush, colourful and very accessible to children, and the voice acting is great, although a faint European" accent is noticeable
date: which I felt only added to the game
recommended: the effect being approximately equivalent to a "neutral" accent making it easy to understand.\nThe gameplay is essentially a fairly linear adventure game with minigames interspersed.  The minigames can certainly be considered educational for the younger kids as well.  The adventure game aspect helps you along by always reminding kids what the next quest is via the map function.\nThere is also a parent guide
hoursPlayed: which helps out if a kid gets stuck.\nMy only two issues (1.5 really) is the game was fairly short
voteText: but considering the low price isn't unexpected.\nThe other being a persistent crash on the Linux version
helpfulPercent: entering the Uncle's garden.  But I'm running an unsupported distribution (so maybe my own fault)
votesHelpful: and thanks to the cloud save

reviewText:
dont let this game fool you with its fake cuddly bear in fact

Should you encounter a black bear

Stay calm - DO NOT RUN (running may elicit a chase response by the bear).

Pick up children so they don't run or scream; restrain dog; avoid eye contact and talk in soothing voice.

If the bear stands up, he is NOT going to attack but is curious and wants a better sniff or view.

Back away slowly; if bear chomps jaw, lunges, or slaps ground or brush with paw, he feels threatened.

Slowly retreat from area or make wide detour around bear; don't crowd or block bear's escape route.


the game is okay tho

reviewText:
Whilst the backgrounds were beautiful, the gameplay is attrocious.

The game conists primarily of talking to an NPC which gives you a problem which you have to go back two screens and talk to someone else to solve.

For example, at one point a shepherd asks you for a painting. Your uncle who is a painter is two screens back, however when you go back you find a goat has blocked the bridge and won't let you past. The shepherd tells you that you can get a cable car a bit further on which will bring you back to town, basically going around the goat. En route you run into a marmot who asks you to help tidy up the rubbish in the area, which results in a minigame. Then you get to the cable car, but it isn't running because an eagle is on the line and won't fly off. The eagle is one screen back and another down a side route (which you cannot access before talking to the cable car operator) and he tells you he can't move because he lost his glasses...which you tidied up before. So you have to go back a few screens talk to the maramot to get the glasses to give to the eagle so you can finally ride the cablecar down and get a picture...

A better game in the genre would have had your uncle give you the painting for helping him, and the maramot give you the glasses for helping her.

Furthermore, despite being a kids game, they use words that I don't know the meaning to. And I'm 24. Your uncle uses the term plein air" assuming that Teddy Floppy Ear should know what it is. When questioned he describes it as an outside atelier
date: another word that Teddy Floppy Ear or a young child is unlikely to know
recommended: unless they are super obsessed with artists. Further on in the game you have to collect carabiners. Whilst there is a picture of them
hoursPlayed: so the task is completable for those who don't know
voteText: an explanation as to what they are isn't given until after the task is completed...\n\nOn that note
helpfulPercent: the guy who asks you to get them could reward you with the string needed a bit later on in the game before you need it."

reviewText: This is possibly THE best adventure puzzle game know to man, monkey, and weird anthropromorpic stuffed animals. This thrilling adventure begins with the ever stonecold star of the show, Teddy Floppy Ear, as he arrives in a isolated town devoid of life as he must seach for items that will aid hes survival in this deadly enviorment. The writing is on par with such classics as Bioshock, Mass Effect 2, TellTale's The Walking Dead. The amount of emotions I felt while playing the piece of art. is beyond description. You will laugh, you will cry, you will love, and you will lose all you have ever cared about in this breath taking adventure. This is literally the best game I have, or ever will, play again. In fact Im so sure of this, that im going to hang myself with my ethernet cable after writing this wonderful review, merely because this is the pinnacle of my life and that nothing will ever be better than Teddy Floppy Ear: Mountain Adventure.\n\n10/10 Truly a perfect piece of art."

reviewText: Great game, kind of a weird story though. It's about a growing bear who's parents both die in a viscious car wreck, and Teddy Floppy Ear is faced with a growing issue of mortality. So after their funerals, he goes off on a mountain adventure he promised his parents he would take before they died but sadly couldn't. So with that in mind, he decided to do it in their honor, hoping its what they would had wanted to do. The whole game is a real downer, especially when it starts to heavily revolve around Teddy's confrontation with mortalilty, and living an unhappy life that he wishes he could escape. Other than that I really enjoyed the visceral landscapes, deep story, amazing graphical quality, and the rich lore that surrounds the game. Not to spoil anything but the ending is a nice close to the game, and really opens it up for a sequal (that I hope they make soon) of which could further the story of Teddy's ongoing struggles of discovering himself through his passion of outdoor exploration. I hope you can find the time to pick up this game of the year contender, because it's been a real sleeper hit for quite a long time. Overall 9.8/10

reviewText:
Teddy, Teddy, Teddy..
If this game was named Teddy Fappy Ear, it would be much more interesting!

The Story:
You're a Teddy bear and you arrive to mountain village. First of all, you realize that your uncle is a DOG! Instead of that a poor homeless bear, who has to beg the bees for a bit of honey in the canine's garden! What has your grandma been doing in her marriage, that's an unsolved mystery! The story is poor, tbh.

Spoiler:
Once you find the uncle dog at the railway station, he tells you to join him in his cabin and leaves you alone. I call this totally irresponsible. But, what could I expect from a dog, right? I just wanted to be sure, the place is safe, also I talked to the train dispatcher, but he didn't even knew the train schedule.. Just great..
A bloodthirsty wolf, disguised as a cute goat granny, offering me a cookie at the next corner - something was telling me these mountains are dangerous.
And I wasn't wrong. I quickly ran to uncle's cabin and that a**hole left me alone again, right after he told me that he was going to paint nearby the lake. Before the selfish ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• left the cabin, he ordered me to bring with me a camera, which was in the dark basement. And of course he lost a key to the basement! So I had to talk to a bee, go back to the train station, my feet were already hurting me and then the stupid magpie told me she has the key in her nest.. I had to head back to the cabin. I was cursing the dog for not having at least bike or something I could use for a fast transportation. Magpie gave me the key, then I was solving homeless bear's food crisis..  And so it went further. Once I solved someone else's problem, another problem popped up. I cannot ignore them, because otherwise they didn't let me pass to the next area. Soon, I wasn't sure, why I either arrived to the mountain village, what was the adventure supposed to be and where is the irresponsible uncle. Once I found him, he ordered me again to take a pictures of five flowers and five animals across the mountain. I had to deal with dangerous eagle, visit a cave with sleeping knights and I was alone the whole time.
No matter I took a sandwich and an apple before I left the cabin - I didn't even had time to stop for eating my snack!
When I finally took all the pictures, I felt I literally wanted to kill the dog. He just left back to the cabin without letting me know and I was looking for him by the lake. Another few miles in my legs. I finally reached the cabin, gave the pictures to the dog and he painted the animals and flowers into the picture.
The dog totally broke my heart, because I realized, he just used me; I found his damn key for the basement, brought him a camera, took pictures for him, brought them back to the cabin and once he finished the painting - he didn't even offered it to me as a souvenir. Instead of that, he gave me a photoalbum, which was supposed to be mine anyways, because I took the pictures, right? And then, I had to head back for the train. I salted my sandwich with tears in the train later.

The Graphics
Kinda cute. I've seen better and worse as well.

The Controling
Sad. It's just point & click. But how to make the game longer? You have to click click click to reach an arrow for a next map. I don't like this.

Other features
Once you finish the story, you are able to play the mini games.

Okay...
Pros:
Minigames
Kinda cute Graphics

Cons
HOW THE **** IS POSSIBLE, THAT A BEAR, WHICH IS SUPPOSED TO BE AT AGE 6 - 12 IS NARRATED BY SOMEONE, WHOSE VOICE SOUNDS LIKE 50 YEARS OLD?!!!! IRRITATING! And the dog's voice sounds much younger. *facepalm*
Controlling.
Story poor

I still recommend, cuz of the mini games.

Worths like for ‚Ç¨ 0,20 - ‚Ç¨ 1,00 but I wouldn't pay more. Really.

reviewText:
although this game is made for small kids, it looked so charming i had to buy it and give it a go.

STORY: you play as a small bear named teddy floppy ear that has just arived in the mountains to visit his uncle.
when we meet the uncle we find out he has a special supprise for teddy, he is going to teach him how to paint!
although its not said in the description on the store page, it has a strong foucus on painting, art, and nature.
teddys job is to take pics of animals and flowers in the mountain side, but along the way you have to help the other animals with there problems. although its a simple story, it was actually kindda interesting. im sure kids will love it.

GRAPHICS: i was not expecting much on this one, i mean, its a kids game that cost 5$....
i was very happy to see that i was wrong. the game looks lovely. it has almost a hand drawn pastel look to it. it has some nice effects spread out to. like when you are on the top of the mountain, you can see hot air ballones floating in
the sky. everything looks really great. my only complaint here is that the character models dont have the best
movements. they look very stiff.

CONTROLS: the controls are pretty good, but not great. they fell very clunky at times, but it dose not really matter that much for this tipe of game. still, the could use some work.

GAMEPLAY: the gameplay in this game really comes down to the mini games spread through out the world.
unfortunatly there are not alot of them. i think there are like 5 or 6 games in the main story. only 1 or 2 i would actually play again.

SOUND: the music is great, the voce acting can be iffy at times. some times its hard to here the characters talk as the other sound are to loud. not much else to say here.

REPLAY VALUE: not great. i beat the game in allitle over an hour. it will take kids longer, but still, short.
once you beat the game you unlock the mini games. this is the after game content. unfortunatly its just the same mini games that we just played i the story. the only one i would play again, would be the painting game.
you get a blank sheet of paper, 4 types of drawing tools (2 paint brushes, 2 pencils) and you can simply draw.
i really enjoyed painting, but i do wish that 1, you had a way to export your paintings to your computer, and 2, they left out the color black..... wich i thought was kinnda odd.
when you beat the game you also unlock 12 puzzels to play that were NOT in the main game. there very simple, but still a nice supprise.

over all i can recomend this game to any one that wants a nice game for there kid, or just wants some good clean fun :)

reviewText:
An incredible adventure in the mountains!
This game is a part of the world-famous and highly ambitious and beloved series Teddy Floppy Ear. It was made by the AAA game studio Forever Entertainment, which is located in Poland, one of the greatest countries for games in general.

Graphics 10/10
The game looks and feels great. It supports all kinds of system and graphics card configurations. It can run at an incredible framerate of 144 frames per second! The game is beautiful, and it's artstyle is very nice. It has a very lovely and calming atmosphere to it. It also features some of the latest and greatest advancements in graphics technology, such as fullscreen mode.

Gameplay 10/10
The gameplay in this game is very enjoyable and well-crafted. It is both calming, relaxing and fun to play through this game, and it will both challenge and reward the play with clever puzzles and mysteries. It is an open-world point-and-click adventure, and the world is also very unique and well made. The player will need to explore and think to make it through. The game is reasonably lengthy, and it can both be played casually or all in one sitting.

Story 9/10
This game follows the story of young Teddy Floppy Ear, who is going on a trip to the mountains to visit his uncle. Teddy Floppy Ear will meet several unique and lovely characters, who all are very unique and have something interesting to say. The story is family friendly, altough some parts might be a bit too violent for children. Teddy Floppy Ear is not very intelligent, so you will have to help him, and he will solve several mysteries and problems while on his adventure. The only complaint i have about the story is the fact that the most interesting and funny character, the bear, does not appear alot in the game.

Controls 10/10
The game controls smoothly and logically. It features mouse controls, and the cursor will change when you hold over a relevant object, so that you can know when something is interactable. There is also a button in the top-left corner, which makes Teddy talk for a few seconds while you can't do anything at all, which is great.

System Requirements 7/10
The game is very well optimized, but it will still require a heafty graphics card to run smoothly. This is mainly because of the intense graphical effects and the realistic fur rendering on the bear i mentioned earlier. It is possibly one of the best looking titles released in recent years, and i personally believe it will be a hallmark for what humans can accomplish. The game still works well on alot of different system configurations, and it supports both Windows, OSX, and Linux. Linux is incredible, and you won't even need a good graphics card if you run it on Ubuntu or something similar. I run Ubuntu, so i found this to be great, and i really respect the developers for it.

Overall 9/10
I found this game to be a great title, and well worth the very low and almost unjustified price of only 4.99‚Ç¨. It features an amazing story, fun and relaxing gameplay and beautiful graphics. It encouraged me to buy the other games, which are a continuation of the story of Teddy Floppy Ear, and i highly recommend getting all 3 games.

reviewText: Teddy Floppy Ear - Mountain Adventure is a devastating tale. A tale of a young boy (Voiced by Kirk Douglas) and his many trials during the Holocaust. You stumble across the dead body of your friend, Captain Crunch as he delivers his final warning. Fear the Hive...". His last words stick with you across your travels. By this point you have already met up with The Icee Bear as he gives you the power to overcome the mighty threats that block your path. You then meet Call of Duty who reminds you what it means to love. However Call of Duty is killed in battle by your long time nemesis Jango Fett. A gripping FPS only for the most emotionally ready souls ready to bear its pain unto your soul."

reviewText:
Graphic: It's a cute and colorful style. It suits the game well.

Sound: Good music and voice actors did a good job. (The Sheeps are funny, but can get a little bit annoying after a while, especially in their minigame.)

Controls: You can completely play it with the mouse and only the left button. It's uncomplicated. They could have made use of the second mouse button sometimes and improve some minigames. In the puzzle-minigame you often turn a piece, when you just want to move it around. In the minigame where you have to catch notes, you have to grab the pot everytime to move it, instead of just having it locked on the mouse.

Gameplay: Some different minigames, which can selected from the main menu screen, after you've played through the game. You can talk to all of the characters in the game which guide you through your quest. If you get stuck, then you still have a map where your next location is shown. You have to walk a lot sometimes, just to hear a short dialogue. This is quite a downside, since the game is very short. But overall, i think playing it is a fun experience.

Ready flaky pastry - 1.5 kg five eggs Flour - 150 g> Sugar - 400 grams Milk - 1200 ml Vanilla sugar - 1 n. Cognac - 1 tbsp. l. Shelled walnuts - glass sequence of preparation: dough defrost naturally at room temperature (defrost time indicated on the package). Cook the custard: grind the egg yolks with a mixer or a whisk to a conventional incandescent and vanilla sugar, flour and brandy to enter the mix. The mixture pour a trickle of milk, stir and cook, stirring constantly. Divide the dough into the desired number of pieces that will later Korzh. Roll out each piece on a board sprinkled with flour. Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes until golden color on a dry baking temperature of 200 degrees. Fluff the cooled cream cakes. If desired, each layer sprinkled with chopped nuts. On top of the cake lightly press smeared with cream and sprinkle all sides crumbs. Add layer cake in a cool place overnight.

reviewText:
Well, what can I say? Teddy Floppy Ear - Mountain Adventure whisked away 113 hours of my life during TWO glorious play-throughs.

You're thrown head first into a rollercoaster experience of escaping from your creepy uncle at the train station, to do what all kids dream of - making it for themselves in the big city.

As the hours were flying by, the replay value of the game really hit home. You can have this entire experience TWICE, once in English and once in Polish!

Only speaking English, I simply considered the Polish version as hardcore mode"
date: akin to being lost in a foreign city where I didn't understand what anyone was saying
recommended: or really how to control the game. Of course
hoursPlayed: I had already completed the game in English
voteText: so I kind of remembered what to do. I got around this by simply pretending I was a Jedi Teddy and it was the Force guiding me.\n\nI laughed
votesTotal: Teddy Floppy Ear Mountain Adventure is a must-buy.\n\n10/10 Foreign Teddy Jedi Adventure."

Because of this perspective

reviewText: A very cute nice game that would be great to grab on sale for 50 cents for kids. This is not a game for teens or adults, its a nice kids game for someone under 10 who likes such games. It has puzzles, things to do, a lot of fun mini-games that are educational and nicely done. If you have children who play on the internet, and like games on the computer, this is a nice one for a young child to fiddle with.

reviewText: Fantastic for the littler kids.  Played all the way through and only needed grownup help twice. Has educational components of logic and problem solving and a little bit of art and puzzle problems, too. The graphics are cute and age appropriate, and the adventure is delightful.  I can't imagine anyone getting stuck, but there is a manual/walk through on the parents section.  Not as much replay value for us, but some may enjoy the minigames that can be done again.

reviewText:
Teddy Floppy Ear - Mountain Adventure is the story of a 50 year old British man trapped in the body of a prepubescent anthropomorphic teddy bear. He arrives at a quiet mountain town, gets abandoned by his uncle a few times, and proceeds to go on a charming mountain adventure taking pictures of flora and fauna whilst simultaneously being a slave for everyone around town. Seriously, Teddy Floppy Ear's instinctual reaction upon meeting someone is to tirelessly labor for them with little reward. Frodo's burden has nothing on this guy, the game might as well be called Teddy Floppy Ear - Mount Doom Adventure. Absoloutely tragic.

Pros:
-Hang out with your uncle (until he abandons you again)
-Meet a sexy bird who's a compulsive thief
-Draw a pretty picture of Hiroshima
-Realistic sheep sounds

Cons:
-Lack of sexy bird sexy scene

Conclusion:
Get this game right now.
